image.altText: An aerial view of houses and commercial buildings in the middle of Lismore, totally surrounded by floods.

props.synopsis: One and a half million Australians are at risk from sea levels rising by 2050 unless climate change can be limited, Australia’s first national climate risk assessment warns.

title.children: Hundreds of thousands could be impacted by sea level rise by 2030: Government report

image.altText: Chris Bowen

props.synopsis: The Climate Council says the increased threat of more bushfires, floods and heatwaves revealed in the National Climate Risk Assessement is a call to action. Follow live.

title.children: Bushfire, flood and heatwave threat a call to action, Climate Council says

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Greens say 'chilling' climate assessment is a wake up call for Labor
Heatwave deaths in Sydney to double under best case scenario
First National Climate Risk Assessment paints a grim picture by 2050

image.altText: ANZ logo outside a bank.

props.synopsis: ANZ bank has agreed to a record penalty with the corporate regulator over its dealings with about 65,000 customers, as well as the federal government.

title.children: 'Grubby': ANZ faces record penalty for ripping off customers and government

image.altText: A man looks ahead with a serious expression. Behind him is a wall of a brick house.

props.synopsis: A controversial church offered to settle with Mick Dover over his allegations of abuse, but only if he signed a non-disclosure agreement.

title.children: 'Not worth it. I'd rather tell you': Mick Dover turned down $1m to do this interview

image.altText: Anthony Albanese standing in front of an Australian flag

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has blamed pro-Palestinian protesters for the closure of his electoral office in Sydney's inner west, but the landlord says there were multiple reasons behind the decision to discontinue the long-standing lease.

title.children: 'Got a bit intense': Church axes PM's office lease in Sydney's inner west

image.altText: A man speaks with his hands to another man.

props.synopsis: A Gold Coast musician approached by a man he knew from a local bar went on to front a trading company, later accused of defrauding millions from ordinary Australian investors.

title.children: Musician turned 'CEO' confronted over investment fraud allegations

image.altText: Hannah Einbinder holding an Emmy smiling at the camera, people blurred behind her

props.synopsis: From a rallying political cry from Hacks star Hannah Einbinder to standing ovations for Stephen Colbert, here are your Emmys 2025 key moments.

title.children: Emmys 2025: From Hannah Einbinder's speech to chants for Stephen Colbert

image.altText: A mugshot of a young caucasian man with brown hair

props.synopsis: Investigators are working to piece together why Tyler Robinson allegedly scaled a rooftop at Utah Valley University during an outdoor event and shot Mr Kirk in the neck at long range.

title.children: Alleged Kirk shooter Tyler Robinson 'not cooperating' with authorities

image.altText: Two fighter jets flying

props.synopsis: Russia is accused of breaching Romania's airspace by sending in a kamikaze Geran-2 drone.

title.children: Second Russian violation in NATO airspace after drone intercepted over Romania

image.altText: Edan van Haren as a young boy smiling, wearing a striped T-shirt.

props.synopsis: Edan van Haren, a victim of child predator Maurice Van Ryn, says legal loopholes are allowing the confessed paedophile to protect his assets in superannuation to avoid paying compensation.

title.children: Paedophile declares bankruptcy to avoid paying $1.4m in damages

image.altText: A man with short greying hair wearing a suit, tie and glasses holds a press conference in front of a Queensland Police backdrop.

props.synopsis: Police allege the death of a man on the Gold Coast earlier this year was an assisted suicide and are investigating the deaths of other people as far back as 2021.

title.children: Three people charged over alleged assisted suicide on Gold Coast

image.altText: Reece Walsh headbutts Hudson Young during the Brisbane Broncos and Canberra Raiders NRL qualifying final.

props.synopsis: Superstar Broncos fullback Reece Walsh will be free to play in the NRL preliminary finals after avoiding suspension for a headbutt on Hudson Young in Brisbane's epic win on Sunday.

title.children: 'You're allowed to headbutt': Stuart's complaint rings true as Walsh dodges ban

image.altText: A male protester wearing a flak jacket and carrying a shield in the middle of a protest

props.synopsis: Protesters in Nepal say their Gen Z-led movement was not just about removing one leader, but about reforming the system to ensure accountability and protect Nepal’s future.

title.children: What happens now in Nepal after new leader takes reins?

image.altText: Map of Australia on a globe.

props.synopsis: Immigration has become a new fault line inside the Liberal Party that will erupt again.

title.children: Some Liberals believe Australia is letting in the wrong immigrants

image.altText: A young man in a button-up shirt, walking out of court while holding a piece of paper.

props.synopsis: One man died and another was injured after Jake Danby struck them with his car outside a Darwin shopping centre in 2024, with the driver then sending a series of "disgusting" text messages about the victims.

title.children: Hit-run driver's 'disgusting' messages aired in court

image.altText: Two men stand next to each other. They are wearing suits.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest hears the system failed First Nations prisoner Clinton Austin before his death.

title.children: Inquest hears prison system failed inmate found unresponsive in cell

image.altText: Two marathon runners cross the line in a tight finish to a marathon

props.synopsis: After running for more than two hours, the winner of the men's marathon at the World Athletics Championships was decided by less than a second.

title.children: Marathon runner creates history in world championship photo finish

image.altText: A lady looking at the camera

props.synopsis: According to the Transport Workers' Union, some rideshare drivers have reported being on the road for up to 18 hours a day, swapping between multiple apps in order to bypass fatigue restrictions.

title.children: Rideshare drivers bypassing fatigue restrictions as cost-of-living hits

image.altText: A white man and white woman sitting in a kitchen looking at the camera

props.synopsis: New report finds mothers do more of the sex education at home, raising concerns that young boys are missing out on key information from their dads.

title.children: Dads avoid sex talks with kids amid concern about online content

image.altText: Four fully enclosed biohazard suits, two white, one orange and one yellow, hanging up.

props.synopsis: Step into one of Australia's few biosafety level 4 facilities, where scientists handle highly transmissible and potentially lethal pathogens such as Ebola and Hendra virus.

title.children: Behind these airlocked doors, Australian scientists study deadly diseases

image.altText: Scott Pendlebury runs with the ball while wearing the Big V of Victoria

props.synopsis: AFL chief executive Andrew Dillon confirms Western Australia will play Victoria in Perth next February in the first State of Origin match since 1999.

title.children: AFL announces State of Origin return with WA-Vic clash confirmed

image.altText: A back view of a modern flood light at a sports stadium on a dark night.

props.synopsis: A 39-year-old man has been charged with giving a Nazi salute at the AFL semifinal in Brisbane on Saturday night.

title.children: Man handed lifetime AFL ban for alleged Nazi salute

image.altText: A woman and man with sunglasses.

props.synopsis: In 2022, the then-17-year-old broke into Ms Lovell's North Lakes home on Boxing Day night and fatally stabbed her in the chest during a struggle. He was sentenced to 14 years in jail last year, but it was reduced last month on appeal.

title.children: Attorney-general makes bid to appeal reduced sentence for Emma Lovell's killer

image.altText: A grey wallaby visible from only the chest upwards surrounded by ferns.

props.synopsis: A study prompted by the deaths of wallabies at a beloved wildlife reserve south of Melbourne finds the population has grown five times larger than what The Briars sanctuary can sustain.

title.children: Council calls urgent meeting as wallabies starve to death at sanctuary

image.altText: A woman on a man's shoulders, both smiling, out the front of a stadium. She has an Aussie flag in hand, he has a yellow wig.

props.synopsis: Largely regarded as one of the most successful modern Olympics, years of work went into ensuring Sydney could fully capitalise on its moment in the spotlight.

title.children: How the 2000 Olympics changed the face of Sydney

image.altText: Suryakumar Yadav and Salman Agha walk past each other

props.synopsis: Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav refuses to shake hands after his side's seven-wicket win over Pakistan at the Asia Cup in the latest controversial episode between the two rivals.

title.children: Pakistan cricketers stunned by India's handshake snub

image.altText: ANZ

props.synopsis: ANZ has been hit with a massive fine for unconscionable conduct impacting 65,000 customers, ranging from the federal government to dead account holders. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ANZ hit with $240m fine for 'unconscionable' conduct, ASX opens lower

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: "Time and time again" - the tawdry tale of ANZ's misconduct and court appearances
Financial impact of ANZ's record penalty limited: J.P. Morgan

image.altText: Arhab Haque looks down at his phone while walking out of court.

props.synopsis: An amateur mixed martial arts fighter sprayed fart gas in a fast food restaurant so he could make TikTok prank videos, a Perth court hears.

title.children: Fart gas sprayed inside Perth fast-food outlets for TikTok clout, court hears

image.altText: Steve Gollschewski stands behind a microphe with the Queensland police logo behind him.

props.synopsis: Mr Gollschewski took immediate leave from the police commissioner role in February after the "unexpected" discovery.

title.children: Queensland police commissioner returns to work after cancer diagnosis

image.altText: A woman is seen from behind and through some fabric hanigng out clothing on a washing line.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne mother-of-two says she waited eight years for a suitable public housing home after fleeing family violence.

title.children: 'The situation is so dire': Survivors of family violence wait years for housing

image.altText: Drone image of a coal mine

props.synopsis: A report obtained by lobby group Lock The Gate under right-to-information laws reveal a mine in central Queensland was releasing sediment into environmentally sensitive areas for more than a decade.

title.children: Documents reveal years of unauthorised releases from Qld coal mine

image.altText: Drone shot above Port Hinchinbrook at low tide. Small channel of water into marina, boat moored next to jetties.

props.synopsis: Mud and silt continue to choke the channel connecting the controversial development to the Great Barrier Reef, once again putting industry and conservationists at odds over the fix.

title.children: Port Hinchinbrook marina full of mud despite $1.5m dredging project

image.altText: Dr Meg O'Connell takes a selfie in front of a grey plane on an ice shelf.

props.synopsis: Expeditioners at Australia's Antarctic stations are taking part in a research project to better understand the impacts of extended deployments

title.children: Understanding 'brain shrink' at Antarctica could help astronauts
